author: Chris Davie
title: Manchester City confident over potential deal for Lionel Messi
text:
Manchester City are reportedly hopeful over a deal for Lionel Messi. (AFP/Getty Images) Manchester City are confident that Barcelona could be open to negotiating a deal for Lionel Messi this summer, according to reports.
The Sunday Express claims that the Spanish champions are not willing to meet the Argentine’s £650,000-a-week contract demand, and with no agreement reached, City believe that a move for the forward could be a possibility.
The reports claims that City will give Pep Guardiola around £200 million to spend and Messi could be the signing that spearheads the summer spree.
Following City’s exit to Monaco in the Champions League earlier this week, reports claimed that the futures of 18 first-team players were in doubt.
(AFP/Getty Images) More: Football When will Chelsea win the title as Conte eyes 21 points?

But Guardiola has insisted that he will not make wholesale changed at the end of the season.
‘The people make a report about our performance in Monaco, and the people said we are going to change 12 or 13 players,’ he said.
‘I am going to assure you it’s impossible today to do that.
‘You have to be a little bit more responsible, you have to imagine being the club.
‘Thirteen players have a contract and maybe you have to pay them to go there, to pay their salaries, and [then] pay £40m or £50m for every player, we are going to spend £500m or £600m, it’s impossible.’
